results.idea: Short-term reversal on average sentiment ranking
results.description: Use snt27_avgranking_19 to capture short-term mean reversion: if recent ranking rose sharply, expect pullback. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using one primary field (high coverage 0.908) and SUGGESTION4 favoring high user/alpha counts. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (field treated as scalar). Coverage >0.6 so SUGGESTION3 not used. Kept implementation short (<=7 operators, 1 datafield) per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence set to 0.60 because sentiment rankings historically mean-revert moderately.

Trend-following on snt27_relpopularity1_14 using ts_zscore to reduce outliers. Applied SUGGESTION1 (single strong field) and SUGGESTION4 (moderate user/alpha counts). SUGGESTION2/3 not needed. Implementation concise and uses <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.65 reflecting reliable popularity momentum.

results.idea: High kurtosis recent sentiment as volatility signal
results.description: Use snt27_kurtosis_16 to identify names with fat-tailed sentiment (higher risk/reward). SUGGESTION1 used single datafield with reasonable coverage; SUGGESTION4 applied (high userCount). No vector ops. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.55 due to indirect mapping from kurtosis to returns.

Long top 50% percentile average (snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13) vs bottom using cross-sectional quantile. SUGGESTION1 used single field with high coverage and alphaCount. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.62 because percentile ranks are robust.

Combine snt27_relpopularity08_11 and snt27_rank_2: divergence between popularity change and domain rank signals reversion. Applied SUGGESTION1 to combine two fields, SUGGESTION4 prefers high-count fields. Coverage OK. SUGGESTION2/3 not needed. KEEP_IN_MIND: two datafields used. Confidence 0.66 as cross-signal improves signal-to-noise.

Capture acceleration in snt27_avgranking_19 via ts_delta of ts_delta (second difference) and zscore it. SUGGESTION1 single field used; SUGGESTION4 satisfied. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.58 for short-term noisy signal.

Use snt27_top75pctrankingavg_9 and snt27_top75pctranking_8 to find names with consistently high top-75 rankings (low dispersion -> durable sentiment). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 considered. Confidence 0.60 given persistence of stable top rankings.

High positive skew in snt27_skewness_21 implies few strong positive mentions; fade extreme skew. SUGGESTION1 single high-user field used. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.54 because skewness relationships are moderate.

Momentum in snt27_totaldomains_17 indicates growing web presence; use ts_returns and normalize cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 used single reliable field; SUGGESTION4 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND preserved. Confidence 0.67 as domain growth often predicts engagement.
Rising snt27_totalcountrydomains_10 suggests international expansion; use ts_zscore to control scale. SUGGESTION1/4 used. Confidence 0.61 as expansion can drive sales.

If snt27_topranking_7 hits new highs vs 60-day range, expect continuation. Used ts_arg_max to detect current max and ts_delay to measure change. SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION3 not required. Confidence 0.63 for persistence of attention.
When snt27_relpopularity1_14 rises but top50 ranking doesn't, expect reversion. Combined two fields per SUGGESTION1. Kept <=2 datafields per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.64 for cross-signal advantage.

results.idea: Low engagement with high kurtosis (mean reversion)
results.description: High snt27_kurtosis_16 but low snt27_totaldomains_17 suggests isolated spikes; fade spikes. Used two fields; SUGGESTION2 not relevant. Confidence 0.56 due to indirect link.

results.idea: Vector-style: average top50 vs overall average
results.description: Compare snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13 to overall snt27_avgranking_19 to find relative outperformance. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 considered. KEEP_IN_MIND honored. Confidence 0.65 for relative rank signals.
Apply ts_decay_linear-like behavior by using ts_zscore of recent mean minus long-run mean: ts_av_diff on snt27_avgranking_19. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence 0.62 for smoothed momentum.

Use ts_std_dev on snt27_relpopularity08_11 to capture volatility; go long when volatility increases with positive returns. Used one field and ts operators per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.59 as volatility-timing is noisy.

results.idea: Domain rank momentum combined with popularity
results.description: Combine ts_returns(snt27_rank_2,7) and ts_returns(snt27_relpopularity1_14,7) to favor concordant momentum. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; kept implementation short. Confidence 0.68 as dual momentum is robust.
Use ts_delay of snt27_avgranking_19 to detect recovery patterns; long when current > lag indicating improving sentiment. Single field per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.57 for seasonal effects.
Cross-sectionally zscore snt27_skewness_21 and short extreme positive skewers. Applied SUGGESTION1/4. Confidence 0.53 given weaker cross-section-return mapping.
If snt27_top75pctrankingavg_9 rises faster than snt27_avgranking_19, expect continued attention. Two-field combo per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Domain quantity to rank ratio (quality signal)
results.description: High totaldomains with low topranking indicates broad but weak engagement; use divide of snt27_totaldomains_17 / snt27_topranking_7. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.64 for quality filtering.

results.idea: Rapid pop spike with low country spread (fade)
results.description: Large ts_delta in snt27_relpopularity08_11 but static snt27_totalcountrydomains_10 implies local spike; fade. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.

Use snt27_website_4 presence and low ts_count_nans to prefer stocks with continuous website signals. Applied SUGGESTION1 using single field presence; ts_count_nans not a datafield but ts_count_nans operator applied to same field. KEEP_IN_MIND kept. Confidence 0.58.
ts_rank on snt27_top50pctranking_15 over 20 days to capture improving rank percentile. SUGGESTION1 used one high-coverage field. Confidence 0.62.
Use ts_product of snt27_relpopularity1_14 over short window to detect consistent growth vs one-day spikes. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: High kurtosis but growing domain base (contrarian)
results.description: When snt27_kurtosis_16 is high but snt27_totaldomains_17 is rising, interpret kurtosis as genuine adoption; go long. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.57.
Low ts_std_dev(snt27_rank_2,60) followed by breakout in ts_returns suggests trend start. Single field; applied ts_std_dev and ts_returns. Confidence 0.66.

Average snt27_top50pctranking_15 and snt27_top75pctranking_8 (treated as two elements) via vec_avg concept: implement as mean of two fields (keeps <=2 fields). SUGGESTION1 used multiple fields. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Relative popularity momentum vs site name mention
results.description: If snt27_relpopularity08_11 rises while snt27_website_4 presence increases, favor. Two fields used; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Top ranking mean-revert after extreme jumps
results.description: If ts_max_diff(snt27_topranking_7, 30) is large, expect mean reversion. Single field and operator. Confidence 0.56.
High relpopularity per domain (snt27_relpopularity1_14 / snt27_totaldomains_17) suggests concentrated interest; prefer. Two fields used respecting KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.65.
A falling snt27_skewness_21 (less positive tail) with rising avg rank may indicate broadening interest; combine two fields. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
Use kth_element to backfill if needed and then detect persistence in snt27_top50pctranking_15 via ts_arg_max. Applied SUGGESTION3 not required for coverage but used for robustness. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Domain-count momentum scaled by popularity zscore
results.description: Multiply ts_returns(snt27_totaldomains_17,30) by ts_zscore(snt27_relpopularity08_11,30) to favor growth with attention. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.
High snt27_totalcountrydomains_10 relative to totaldomains suggests geographic diversification: prefer. Used two fields implicitly via ratio with totaldomains. Confidence 0.59.
Require ts_std_dev(snt27_topranking_7,60) below threshold then take positive ts_returns; implemented via if_else with zscore. KEEP_IN_MIND kept small. Confidence 0.64.
Normalize snt27_relpopularity1_14 cross-sectionally and reverse to capture mean reversion in popularity. SUGGESTION1/4 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Sum normalized top50 and top75 percentile ranks to create composite attention metric. Uses two fields respecting KEEP_IN_MIND. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence 0.62.
Use snt27_wq_pit_12 ts_delta to detect surge in PIT-simulated mentions; go long on positive spikes. Single field used; coverage good. Confidence 0.58.
If snt27_topranking_7 remains high but snt27_relpopularity1_14 falls, short as attention may be waning. Two fields used. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Relative popularity momentum after low-nan periods
results.description: Use ts_count_nans(snt27_relpopularity08_11,30) to avoid names with sparse data; prefer names with low NaNs and rising popularity. Single field with operator. Confidence 0.61.
Cross-sectional zscore of snt27_avgranking_19 and reverse to fade extremes. SUGGESTION1 used single strong field. Confidence 0.64.
Divide snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13 by snt27_totaldomains_17 to capture concentrated high-quality attention. Two fields. Confidence 0.62.
Declining snt27_kurtosis_16 after a spike may indicate stabilization; long on negative ts_delta of kurtosis. Single field used. Confidence 0.55.
Combine snt27_skewness_21 and snt27_relpopularity08_11: positive popularity with low skew implies broad adoption. Two fields per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.63.
Detect when current snt27_top75pctranking_8 is highest in 45 days (ts_arg_max==0) and go long. Single field. Confidence 0.61.
High ts_returns(snt27_totaldomains_17,30) filtered by low kurtosis to avoid spike-driven growth. Two fields used. Confidence 0.60.
Subtract snt27_avgranking_19 from snt27_topranking_7 to find concentration of top mentions; use as value signal. Two fields. Confidence 0.59.
Increase in unique TLDs (snt27_dltcc_3 interpreted as count) signals global reach; use ts_returns. Single field. Confidence 0.57.
Large ts_delta(snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13,3) suggests sudden uplift; go long only if supported by rising totaldomains. Two fields used. Confidence 0.62.
Use winsorize on ts_returns(snt27_relpopularity1_14,7) to limit outliers then quantile. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Composite stability: low skew, low kurtosis
results.description: Favor names with low snt27_skewness_21 and low snt27_kurtosis_16 as stable attention; average their zscores. Two fields. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Top rank momentum after low dispersion
results.description: If group of top ranks compresses (low std) and one name breaks out, follow breakout. Implement via ts_std_dev and ts_arg_max on snt27_topranking_7. Single field. Confidence 0.65.
Long when relpopularity rises and skewness drops (broadening). Two fields used; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Top50 avg momentum with zscore overlay
results.description: zscore(ts_returns(snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13,10)) gives robust momentum signal; single field used. Confidence 0.63.
Normalize snt27_totaldomains_17 cross-sectionally to downweight extremes. SUGGESTION1 applied; KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.6.
Compute ts_zscore of snt27_relpopularity1_14 over 90 days to capture unusually high popularity. Single field. Confidence 0.64.
If snt27_topranking_7 drops but average ranking remains, fade the drop expecting mean reversion. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Popularity to top rank correlation (momentum filter)
results.description: High ts_corr(snt27_relpopularity1_14, snt27_topranking_7, 30) implies aligned signals; long when positive. Two fields used and ts_corr operator. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Average ranking long after count backfill
results.description: Use ts_backfill(snt27_avgranking_19,7) to handle missing then take ts_returns for momentum. Applied SUGGESTION3 proactively though coverage high. Confidence 0.59.
Combine snt27_top50pctranking_15 and snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13 by subtracting avg from instant rank to find improving stocks. Two fields used. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Domain count momentum with winsorized extremes
results.description: Apply winsorize to ts_returns(snt27_totaldomains_17,30) to suppress outliers before ranking. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.6.
Use ts_ir(snt27_relpopularity08_11,30) to favor names with consistent positive returns relative to volatility. Single high-quality field used. Confidence 0.66.
If ts_arg_min(snt27_topranking_7,10)==0 (new low rank number = better), favor. Single field used. Confidence 0.61.
Long popularity momentum only if kurtosis is moderate (avoid spikes). Two fields used, keeps implementation simple. Confidence 0.58.
Use quantile(zscore(snt27_avgranking_19)) cross-sectionally to get uniform ranking. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.63.
Combine ts_mean(snt27_top75pctranking_8,60) with low ts_std_dev to prefer durable performers. Single field used via two time-series operators. Confidence 0.60.
If snt27_website_4 mention count spikes but ts_count_nans high historically, treat carefully; use kth_element backfill. Applied SUGGESTION3 conservatively. Confidence 0.55.
Multiply ts_returns(snt27_top50pctranking_15,7) and ts_returns(snt27_relpopularity08_11,7) to favor concordant movers. Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.
Downweight popularity momentum when snt27_kurtosis_16 is high by dividing by kurtosis zscore. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Boost rank momentum when skewness indicates broad positive mentions (low skew). Combine two fields. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Top ranking mean-revert after high std
results.description: When ts_std_dev(snt27_topranking_7,30) is high, expect reversion; reverse zscore. Single field. Confidence 0.58.
Divide relpopularity by totalcountrydomains to assess per-country strength. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Top50 rising with low overall average (discoveries)
results.description: If snt27_top50pctranking_15 rises but snt27_avgranking_19 flat, it's a discovery; combine two fields. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Domain breadth momentum after count backfill
results.description: Backfill totaldomains via ts_backfill then take momentum to capture resumed reporting. Applied SUGGESTION3 though coverage high to be robust. Confidence 0.59.
Use ts_ir(snt27_relpopularity1_14,60) to detect names with high information ratio in popularity metric. Single field. Confidence 0.66.
Scale to recent min-max via ts_scale(snt27_topranking_7,60) and long when near max. Single field. Confidence 0.62.
ts_corr between snt27_relpopularity08_11 and snt27_website_4 over 30 days; favor when high correlation indicates real attention. Two fields used. Confidence 0.64.
Winsorize ts_returns(snt27_top50pctranking_15,7) then normalize cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: High website PIT with rising popularity
results.description: Combine snt27_wq_pit_12 increases and snt27_relpopularity1_14 momentum to capture campaigns. Two fields used. Confidence 0.60.
Reverse zscore(snt27_top75pctranking_8) cross-sectionally to fade extremes. Single field used. Confidence 0.61.
Prefer popularity momentum when kurtosis low; divide or filter accordingly. Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Second derivative via ts_delta(ts_delta(snt27_topranking_7,3),1) and zscore to capture accelerating attention. Single field. Confidence 0.60.
Divide totaldomains by totalcountrydomains to find depth per country; rising ratio indicates concentration growth. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
If current relpopularity is the max in 30 days (ts_arg_max==0) and persists for 3 days, follow. Single field and argmax operator. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Top50 average vs top75 difference signal
results.description: Subtract snt27_top75pctrankingavg_9 from snt27_top50pctrankingavg_13 to detect shifting concentration. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Adjust popularity returns by inverse skewness to prefer broad-based increases. Two fields used. Confidence 0.60.

results.idea: Composite attention score: top rank + popularity
results.description: Add normalized snt27_topranking_7 and snt27_relpopularity1_14 to form composite attention metric. Two fields used respecting KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Top-rank momentum conditioned on website presence
results.description: Only take rank momentum if website mentions exist (snt27_website_4 not NaN). Use trade_when-like logic via if_else(is_nan). Applied SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Popularity mean-revert after high ts_product (sustained run)
results.description: If ts_product(snt27_relpopularity1_14,7) large (sustained run), expect some pullback; reverse. Single field. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Top50 rising with increasing country spread
results.description: Long when snt27_top50pctranking_15 rises and snt27_totalcountrydomains_10 also rises, indicating global adoption. Two fields used. Confidence 0.63.
Apply winsorize to snt27_avgranking_19 then zscore to reduce outliers. SUGGESTION1 used high-coverage field. Confidence 0.62.
If ts_std_dev(snt27_topranking_7,20) increases sharply, follow the recent direction (ts_returns). Single field. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Popularity acceleration after low nan count
results.description: Prefer names with low ts_count_nans(snt27_relpopularity08_11,30) and accelerating popularity. Single field used with two operators. Confidence 0.6.
If snt27_top75pctranking_8 outperforms snt27_top50pctranking_15, it signals depth; subtract two fields. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Normalize ts_returns(snt27_website_4,14) cross-sectionally to get relative website momentum. Single field. Confidence 0.59.
Divide ts_returns(snt27_relpopularity1_14,14) by ts_returns(snt27_topranking_7,14) to capture popularity per top attention change. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
